flawed_nl_solution:
His smaller truck is 8000*0.3=<<8000*0.3=4200>>4200 gallons smaller
So it can transport 8000-4200=<<8000-4200=3800>>3800 gallons
There are 6-2-1=<<6-2-1=3>>3 of the very large trucks
Those trucks are each 8000*0.5=<<8000*0.5=4000>>4000 gallons larger
So they can transport 8000+4000=<<8000+4000=12000>>12000 gallons
So in total they transport 3*12000=<<3*12000=36000>>36000
The 8000-gallon trucks can transport 8000*2=<<8000*2=16000>>16000 gallons
So in total he can transport 3800+16000+36000=<<3800+16000+36000=55800>>55800 gallons
#### 55800

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 2400, not 4200. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
